Title.evidence: The NEPAFOX trial evaluated perioperative treatment with FOLFIRINOX in resectable pancreatic cancer.

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicenter phase II trial randomized patients with resectable or borderline resectable pancreatic cancer without metastases.

Participants.evidence: randomized patients with resectable or borderline resectable pancreatic cancer without metastases

Intervention.evidence: randomized patients into arm (A,) upfront surgery plus adjuvant gemcitabine, or arm (B,) perioperative FOLFIRINOX.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was overall survival (OS).

Number_Randomised.evidence: recruitment was prematurely stopped after randomization of 40 of the planned 126 patients (A: 21, B: 19).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 21 patients in arm A and 19 patients in arm B, 17 and 7 underwent curative surgery

Result_Outcome.evidence: Median RFS/PFS was almost doubled in arm B (14.1 months) compared with arm A (8.4 months)

Harms.evidence: Perioperative morbidity occurred in 72% in arm A and 46% in arm B, whereas non-surgical toxicity was comparable in both arms.
